subject: GPS, standard output, translation
body:
Hi All,

After more than 30 years shooting fotos with film, i use now a
second-hand digital cam wich produce *.NEF files.


PC env : Ubuntu 7.04


'gpscorrelate' synchronise GPS-time and cam-time to give the position of
the 'shooter'.


As example :

'gpscorrelate -o DSC_0934.NEF.dcraw-a.gimp.jpg' 

produce following standard output (line 1) :


"DSC_0934.NEF.dcraw-a.gimp.jpg","2007:05:06_09:22:32",46.803167,6.634500,434.287900


A 'waypoints'-file read by 'gpsman' looks like (line 2):


0934->2007:05:06_09:22:32->N46.812167->E6.634500->symbol=triangle_blue->alt=434.287900
^
name of the waypoint = number of the foto, '->' means TAB



To translate line 1 into line 2, any help would be appreciated

Best regards and thanks,
Pierre


-- 
To unsubscribe, e-mail: beginners-unsubscribe@perl.org
For additional commands, e-mail: beginners-help@perl.org
